Fiora Firetooth BOT 07-07-2024 18:45
As if on cue, a sudden flash of deep orange light comes from upstairs, briefly illuminating the silhouettes of four people at the top of the stairs. A bald man is blasted down the steps, body wreathed in smoke with orange embers eating away at his clothes. He lands in a hissing heap on the floor of the tavern and groans. A few more flashes reveal snapshots of a fight in progress. After another burst of light, the fighting and screams fall silent. A pair of reddish brown heeled leather boots began to walk down the stairs, towards the man who'd been thrown down them earlier, who was slowly trying to crawl towards the exit. When she reached the bottom, Fiora Firetooth steps over him, turns, and crushes his finger tips under her boots. She crouches down and grabs his scorched chin - holding his face up so he was looking directly at her. "Now, now, now luv' - that were a bit fuckin' stupid weren't it? Did y'really think yerself and a few of 'yer bummy mates could beat me?" She moved her grip from his chin to his cheeks, squeezing his mouth together and digging her taloned fingers into his skin. "I'll see ya in a few days, Leeroy, and ye' better have my gold." She brings her other hand to his temple, gently stroking it with another pitch black talon - which gradually began to glow red hot - slowly singing his skin. He tries to yell in pain, but can't open his mouth due to her razor grip. "Or I'm gonna take it back in body bits. Got it?" She squeezes his face extra tight - enough to draw blood - and then drops him to the ground. He eagerly scampers to his feet and pushes past her, rushing to the tavern exit and disappearing into the night, scorched clothes and wounded pride. Fiora walks to the bar, tilting her head to one side until her neck cracked, and addresses the bartender. "Somebody's made an awful mess upstairs. Yer' gonna need a broom to brush up whatever's left of 'em."

With that, the party make their final preparations, packing their most essential equipment, leaving behind bulky additional items at the house. As they leave the village, very few villagers are seen out on the streets this morning, and the town has an eerie gloom hanging over it, in vast contrast to the warmth and celebration of the Fire Festival that the pub crawlers previously attended. Heading out of Krezk, they pick up the Raven River that runs nearby the Old Svalich Road, and see that the water is similarly fouled here. They start to follow the river up-stream, turning north from the road into the Svalich Woods, with the Baratok Mountains in the distance. They trek for a good few hours, undisturbed by unwanted attention, travelling as they do in the gloomy daylight. The road has given way to a dirt track, but it is simply followed through the woods. After those few hours of passed, as the sun is nearing its peak for the day, they come across the secluded Lake Baratok, a cold mountain lake enclosed by misty woods and rocky bluffs. Thick fog creeps across the dark, still waters. The trail ends at a grass-covered causeway that stretches a hundred yards across the lake to a flat, marshy island with a stone tower on it. The tower is old and decrepit, with collapsing scaffolds clinging to one side where a large gash has split the wall. Timeworn griffon statues, their wings and flanks covered with moss, perch atop buttresses that support the walls. Parked near the base of the tower, within sight of the entrance, is a barrel-topped wagon spattered with mud. The lake here, despite its size, is sickened by the same foul poison of the pool in Krezk. However, it is clear that the issue is worst on the western banks of the lake, with the trees and foliage there also looking sickly compared to the same trees on the eastern banks.
